definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: We stood there listening to our own breathing.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在那里聆听着我们自己的呼吸声。

sentences.english: Listen to yourself and do what excites you.
sentences.chinese: 聆听你内心的想法，做自己想做的事。

sentences.english: Play that song You and I listened to .
sentences.chinese: 播放那首我们曾聆听过的歌吧。

sentences.english: Listen and you shall hear God speak.
sentences.chinese: 聆听，你就会听到上帝说话。

sentences.english: The music is all around us, all you have to do, is listening.
sentences.chinese: 只要倾耳聆听，音乐便无处不在。

sentences.english: And, as sheep, we need to listen for his voice.
sentences.chinese: 那么，作为小羊，我们应该聆听他的声音。

sentences.english: The eloquence of the President moved all hearts who listened to him.
sentences.chinese: 总统的辩才感动了所有聆听者的心。

sentences.english: After we have listened, we have to talk with God in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 我们聆听了神的话后，必须在祷告中与神对谈。

sentences.english: Tonight, I am listening to a deeper way.
sentences.chinese: 今夜，我聆听来自更深处的声音。

sentences.english: I rap for listeners, blunt heads, fly ladies and prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我为聆听者，大麻叶而说唱，也能让女士，囚徒。

sentences.english: Show you’re listening by your nonverbal communication.
sentences.chinese: 用你的肢体语言表明你正在聆听。

sentences.english: A good listener must be good at asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 一个好的聆听者应该善于问问题。

sentences.english: Listen to the world around you.
sentences.chinese: 细细聆听你耳旁的这个世界。

definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to discuss in whispered tones/whispered conversation
to prick up one's ear/to listen attentively
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
